name: The Future of Space Launch is Near
blurb: An illustrated guide to SpaceX's launch vehicle reusability plans; cowritten with John Gardi and published on 13 December 2014, just 6 days before the original launch date of CRS-5.

name: Indoc: inline documentation generator
blurb: A NodeJS library/command line tool to generate documentation from comments in the code. It's similar to (and inspired by) docco, but indoc creates documentation for a unified project instead of a per-file basis.

name: Launch Vehicle and Spacecraft Infographics
blurb: A series of infographics that explain the concepts and engineering behind launch vehicles, spacecraft, and their trajectories. Featuring SpaceX and ULA vehicles.

name: SpaceX's Journey to Mars: 2018 Red Dragon
blurb: A short article, designed for those new to SpaceX, that explains the 2018 Red Dragon mission

name: Autogyro
blurb: Manually control the orientation of your Android device, no gyroscope necessary.

name: Air Traffic Control
blurb: An air traffic control simulation game that runs in any browser. 100% free.

name: SpaceX Falcon 9 v1.2
blurb: A very high quality model of the upcoming SpaceX Falcon 9 v1.2 rocket.

name: Falcon 9 vs New Shepard
blurb: A to-scale comparison of the New Shepard flight and the Falcon 9 return to launch site.

name: Earth and moon
blurb: High quality render of the Earth and moon

name: Team Fortress 2 Sentry Gun
blurb: Team Fortress 2's level 1 sentry gun. Modeling, shading, and rendering took 8 hours from start to finish. The only textures in the image are the concrete and the walls; the sentry texturing is entirely procedural.

name: Piper Archer CX
blurb: A semi-fictional general aviation aircraft for the FlightGear flight simulator.

name: Tesla Model S postcard
blurb: Intended to be given out by the owner to those interested in the Model S.

name: F9R-Dev2D
blurb: A simple 2D Falcon 9 test vehicle simulation, featuring semi-realistic gameplay — er, simulation — and an autopilot.

name: Low-poly rocket and plane
blurb: A low-poly rocket and plane. Originally created as concept art for an abandoned space game.

name: SpaceX Falcon 9 v1.1 and Dragon v2 game model
blurb: A game-quality model of the Falcon 9 v1.1 and Dragon v2; the F9 model is 8300 polys while the Dv2 is 9200.
